DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a colon cancer was histologically documented.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a documented colon.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The part of the large intestine between the cecum and the rectum; it extracts moisture from food residues before they are excreted.

Concepts.definition: The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.

Property.preferredDefinition: Documented; furnished with or supported by documents.

Concepts.definition: Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Histologically documented ade
ReferenceDocuments.description: Histologically documented adenocarcinoma of the colon

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologically/pathologically confirmed stage IIA adenocarcinoma of the colon (T3, N0, M0) with at least 12 lymph nodes examined at the time of surgical resection?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologically confirmed colon adenocarcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histologically/pathologically confirmed colon adenocarcinoma with R0 resection?
